text.text_translated: In the past, most bridges were made of wood. Fire was a very big danger for them. They caught fire easily. This was especially true for old train bridges. Trains had steel wheels and tracks. The wheels moved on the tracks. This made a spark. A spark is a small, hot light. Sometimes, this spark made the wood bridge catch fire. Then the whole bridge would burn down.

best_attempt.text_translated: In the past, most bridges were made of wood. They caught fire more easily. Fire could destroy them fast. This was especially true for old train bridges. Trains had steel wheels and tracks. Sometimes, a spark came from these parts. The spark could make the wood bridge catch fire. Then the whole bridge would burn down.
